Master Answer:
ImmunizeBC does not have that information. Tips for locating immunization records are here.  According to History of immunization in BC, a Measles/Rubella (MR) campaign was done in 1996 from elementary through post-secondary school students (birth year cohorts 1979-1991).
For all individuals born after January 1, 1970, two doses of measles-containing vaccine are recommended. Read more about measles and the vaccine here.
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: I received a booster for Rubella at the pop-up immunization clinic at UBC during the Rubella outbreak of 1997. Would that have been Rubella only, or the full MMR?
Master Question variation 1: how often would i get rubella boosters
